intro: Acmella buphthalmoides, commonly known as the false pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, spherical inflorescence composed of numerous small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Acmella buphthalmoides is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive, daisy-like appearance.
